definition: (of a contagious disease etc) to spread/to propagate/(of a style of clothing, song etc) popular/fashionable
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
qualities that make sth popular or fashionable/(of a disease) epidemic

sentences.english: What does pop music do for us that's very helpful?
sentences.chinese: 就这点而言流行音乐对我们来说有什么用处呢？

sentences.english: Piscine mouth shoe, afterwards follow on current goes this year, if show, toe is like concealed, very sexy.
sentences.chinese: 鱼嘴鞋，今年继续流行，脚趾若隐若现，十分性感。

sentences.english: The poem was all the rage then.
sentences.chinese: 这首诗在当时十分流行。

sentences.english: Some of the most popular expressions are those that are guaranteed not to offend anyone.
sentences.chinese: 一些最流行的表达是那些保证不会得罪任何人的表达。

sentences.english: By no means are BlackBerry phones unpopular.
Wind-bells are popular in our bedroom.
These are all the latest fashion.
sentences.chinese: 这些都是最流行的款式了。

sentences.english: A third crisis, pandemic influenza, lurks in the future.
sentences.chinese: 第三个危机是隐伏于未来的大流行性流感。

sentences.english: Research on the epidemiologic characteristics and risk factors of arsenic-induced skin cancer were reviewed in detail.
sentences.chinese: 本文系综论皮肤砷癌的流行病学特做与危险因子。

sentences.english: The 120-degree CCPM is by far most popular among pilots of all levels.
sentences.chinese: 在各层水平的飞手中，目前120度十字盘最为流行。

sentences.english: HHP is a popular online abbreviation for "haha point".
sentences.chinese: HHP是网络流行用语，表示“笑点”的意思。

sentences.english: Yoga is very popular especially in Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 瑜伽在洛杉矶尤其流行。

sentences.english: Localised epidemics and global pandemics periodically pose a significant national and global threat.
sentences.chinese: 局部和全球的的流行病时不时的威胁着我们。

sentences.english: Do you like any pop music in particular?
sentences.chinese: 你有特别喜欢的流行音乐吗？

sentences.english: Popular cold-weather beverages also can be packed with calories, fat and sugar.
sentences.chinese: 冬季里流行的饮品也富含卡路里，脂肪和糖分。

sentences.english: One of the things that makes the game so popular is its simplicity.
sentences.chinese: 让这游戏变得如此流行的原因之一其实是它的简单。

definition: to be in vogue/to be prevalent
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
to be popular for a while/to be all the rage for a time
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
fashionable for a while (idiom); all the rage
old-fashioned/out of date/to be later than the time stipulated or agreed upon
to keep up with the latest fashion
